Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates wearing festival wreath headdress. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. White (gypsum?) coating with red paint on hair and pink paint on headdress. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Gutch dated this piece to between 150BC and 250AD (Hogarth 1899, Pl.12, no.164). Close parallel dated to the 2nd century BC (Fischer 1994, Pl.67. no.648). Fischer, J. 1994. ‘Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen’. Tübingen: Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.053) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 91, no. 164, pl. XII, no.164)
